Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness, improper evidence assessment
Evidence_Assessment: Officer failed to acknowledge submitted documents on work experience and English proficiency
Legal_Rule: Officers must ensure procedural fairness and reasonably assess submitted evidence
Procedural_Issue: Officer requested already submitted documents, lacked transparency in scoring
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient justification for denial of points in 'Experience' and 'English Proficiency'
Outcome_on_Merits: Application had sufficient evidence; decision overturned
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Breach found: officer misled applicant and failed to provide rationale
Key_Evidence_Considered: Work experience documentation, English language test results or statements
Applicant_Challenge: Dismissal of application due to alleged lack of evidence
Court_Result: Judicial review allowed, decision set aside
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, application forms, supporting credentials
Remedy_Sought: Reassessment of application with procedural fairness
Legal_Provision: Sections under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act relating to skilled worker assessment
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Insufficient work experience and language proficiency
Governing_Rule: Duty of fairness in administrative decision-making
